intro: Specklinia graminea, commonly known as the grassy bryophyte, is a member of the family Dendroboraceae. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on tree trunks or branches in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its dense, grass-like foliage and compact growth habit. It thrives in humid environments with high light exposure and moderate temperatures. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on epiphytic plant adaptations.
